DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeric value which captures the SUVpeak which is equal to the mean SUV determined from a circular 2D ROI (0.75 to 1.5cm in diameter) drawn in transaxial slice and centered on the maximum value pixel in that ROI.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The SUVpeak is equal to the mean SUV determined from a circular 2D ROI (0.75 to 1.5cm in diameter) drawn in transaxial slice and centered on the maximum value pixel in that ROI.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: The most extreme possible amount or value; the highest point.:An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) 1[injected dose (nCi) 1 body weight (g)].

Concepts.definition: The most extreme possible amount or value; the highest point.

An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/10 Created for use in Image SUV Calculation Module to replace released DEC using meta concepts

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a standardized uptake ratio value generated during a positron emission tomography scan.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: 9/7/10 removed - not a DICOM attribute; to be moved to a PET module per Sept 1 call with ACRIN team.  8/29/10 Released for use in Image SUV Calculation Module
